[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "curl -sL -k --max-time 15 \"https://qrshs.com/\" 2>&1 | python3 -c \"\nimport sys, re\nhtml = sys.stdin.read()\n# Extract visible text from key elements\nfor tag in ['h1','h2','h3','h4','p','li','a']:\n    for m in re.finditer(f'<{tag}[^>]*>(.*?)</{tag}>', html, re.DOTALL|re.IGNORECASE):\n        text = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', '', m.group(1)).strip()\n        if text and len(text) > 10 and len(text) < 500:\n            print(f'[{tag}] {text}')\n\" 2>&1 | head -80"
}

[p] PARADIGM+ Practice Management System provides robust operational strength by streamlining your business processes while increasing cash flow and revenue.
[p] QRS INC. was founded in 1983 to help providers become profitable and to support them in their goals of better healthcare for their patients. We are proud of what we do, and we work hard to create a support environment built on personal relationships and promises kept.
[p] By choosing QRS to be your medical practice solutions provider not only will you be getting the best software and hardware products for your practice but also the wealth of experience of a company that has been helping medical practices for more than 35 years.
[p] Our entire team wants your experience with PARADIGM to be great. Our clients recognize that our greatest value is the exceptional support that we provide. [p] We also offer Electronic Statement Services. This allows your practice to rid itself of the labor intensive task of printing, stuffing and mailing statements.
[p] QRS offers a complete line of network services. Please contact us to discuss your needs.
[p] QRS offers a full range of hardware, and hardware installation and repair services.
[p] Training is a must to get the most out of your system. QRS offers several training options for your practice. You may take advantage of any and all of the options presented.
[p] Coming from another system? QRS has converted from hundreds of other Practice Management Systems into the PARADIGM software.
[p] QRS can automatically back-up your PARADIGM data every 24 hours to our office in Knoxville and then your data is backed up to a second offsite secure server location. This provides for redundant backup recovery options.
[p] PARADIGM ARS offers practices a complete, easy-to-use messaging solution for delivering appointment reminders.

[RESULT: [h1] PARADIGM EHR
[h2] Request A Free Demo
[h2] PARADIGM EHR
[h2] Get in Touch
[h3] Optional Modules:
[h4] Patient Flow
[h4] Custom Chart Layout
[h4] Speech Recognition
[h4] Dynamic Fee Slip
[h4] Patient Search
[h4] Note Generation
[h4] Prescriptions
[h4] Recall / Follow ups
[h4] Scanning (tif, pdf, jpg)
[p] PARADIGM EHR is our premium easy to use Electronic Health Records software product. PARADIGM EHR integrates scanning, electronic documents, note generation and work flow all into one system. This allows you to fully automate your charts completely eliminating the need for paper copies. PARADIGM EHR allows you to store virtually any type of file securely and quickly in a patient’s electronic chart.
[p] We are here to improve your practice by installing the best and most efficient software and hardware solutions. Please fill up this form so we can assist you
[p] Phone Number
[p] Email Address
[p] Practice Name
[p] Role in Office
[p] EHR

							PARADIGM EHR
[p] PM
				
					
						PM
						
							
							PARADIGM PM
[p] Key Features of PARADIGM EHR for Medical Practice
[p] Benefits of Using PARADIGM EHR
[p] Why Choose PARADIGM EHR for Your Electronic Health Records?
[p] PARADIGM EHR is designed to meet the evolving needs of healthcare providers and patients in the digital age. Our focus on usability, efficiency, and security makes PARADIGM EHR the ideal choice for medical practices seeking to optimize electronic health records management. With a commitment to improving healthcare outcomes, our EHR solution helps practices of all sizes reduce administrative burden, enhance patient care, and maintain regulatory compliance.
[p] Get Started with PARADIGM EHR Today
[p] Ready to transform your medical practice with an advanced Electronic Health Record system? Schedule a demo today to explore the features of PARADIGM EHR and discover how it can simplify your workflows, enhance patient care, and optimize your medical practice management.
[p] Patient Flow gives you a view of the day’s schedule. Color coding allows you to see patients that are checked in, in care, have had a fee slip created, and are check out.
[p] PARADIGM EHR works for you. This is accomplished by allowing you to customize your chart’s configuration. You may create tabs to categorize and store information, making it quick and easy to find. Our implementation specialists will assist you in creating the best chart layout for you.
[p] PARADIGM EHR supports the use of Speech Recognition software. Use the tool to enter data into forms reducing the inaccuracies sometimes associated with keyboard entry.
[p] PARADIGM EHR supports the use of Speech Recognition software. Use the tool to enter data into forms reducing the inaccuracies sometimes associated with keyboard entry.
[p] PARADIGM EHR has the capacity to store voice files with a specific Encounter. The .wav file can: be filed away in any tab section in the patient’s chart, remain attached to a specific Encounter and of course be transcribed to text into a document. Manage the file in the way that works best for you.
[p] PARADIGM has all the standard management reports that you would use to work things such as delinquent accounts and insurance claims, but we have taken it to the next level with Electronic Work Lists.
[p] Allows you to search through the patient database with ease.
[p] PARADIGM EHR generates a comprehensive final summary note for each Encounter. Your note can be customized to feature only the clinical areas you need to communicate.
[p] PARADIGM EHR gives the practice the ability to issue a prescription, refill an existing prescription and enter historical medication information. PARADIGM EHR automatically files the prescription away in a place designated for medications.
[p] You can use PARADIGM EHR to immediately enter Recall or Follow-up appointments for the patient. Both automatically will be entered into the PARADIGM Appointment Scheduling System.
[p] Scanning can be one of the most demanding tasks that medical facilities face when working with an electronic medical record. PARADIGM EHR makes it an easy task by offering you scanning options to fit different scenarios.
[p] HL7 &#8211; Intervaces (Labs, Hospitals, Collection Agencies)
[p] Please fill out this form so we can assist you with your inquiry.Our team will reply within 24 hours.

  "command": "# Fetch PM product page\ncurl -sL -k --max-time 15 \"https://www.qrshs.com/paradigm-pm/\" 2>&1 | python3 -c \"\nimport sys, re\nhtml = sys.stdin.read()\nfor tag in ['h1','h2','h3','h4','p','li']:\n    for m in re.finditer(f'<{tag}[^>]*>(.*?)</{tag}>', html, re.DOTALL|re.IGNORECASE):\n        text = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', '', m.group(1)).strip()\n        if text and len(text) > 10 and len(text) < 500:\n            print(f'[{tag}] {text}')\n\" 2>&1 | head -80"
}

[h2] Request A Free Demo
[h2] Practice Management System
[h2] Get in Touch

[h4] Claims Scrubbing

[h4] Referral Management

[h4] Claims Error Information Management
[h4] Line Item Posting
[p] Transform Your Medical Practice with PARADIGM PM
[p] PARADIGM PM is the ultimate Practice Management software designed to streamline every aspect of running a medical practice. From scheduling patient appointments to handling medical practice billing, PARADIGM PM simplifies and automates key administrative tasks, allowing healthcare providers to focus on delivering high-quality patient care. Our integrated platform is built for efficiency, reducing administrative burdens and improving the overall productivity of medical practices of all sizes.
[p] RADIGM was designed as a single product with all the benefits of an EHR and Practice Management system. It is not a cobbled together system built from systems that were acquired by purchasing other companies. PARADIGM shares a single database between the EHR and the Practice Management system. This means you will never have to enter data twice.
[p] We are here to improve your practice by installing the best and most efficient software and hardware solutions. Please fill up this form so we can assist you

[p] Key Features of PARADIGM PM for Medical Practice Management
[p] Benefits of Using PARADIGM PM for Medical Practice Management
[p] Get Started with PARADIGM PM Today
[p] Ready to see how PARADIGM PM can transform your medical practice management? Schedule a demo today to explore our practice management features and discover how PARADIGM PM can simplify your administrative tasks, improve medical billing efficiency, and elevate your patient care.
[p] Simply, user-friendly and effective
[p] Comprehensive Practice Suite
[p] Interfaces with vendor applications
[p] Custom interfaces and/or ODBC
[p] A popular axiom of management says, “If you can’t measure it, you can’t manage it.” You won’t need to worry about getting the reports you need with PARADIGM.
[p] PARADIGM’s Contract Management features provide you with consolidated management of multiple insurance plans that are under a common contract
[p] Using the Claims Manager, you can see all the different types of claims that you either print or send electronically.
[p] The PARADIGM system streamlines the billing operation. With our single screen concept, you have the ability to post charges, payments, adjustments, as well as messages and notes to an encounter.
[p] PARADIGM contains a Refund program that lets you easily manage refunds and printing checks. Simply inserting a special refund command on an encounter automatically sets a check to be printed.
[p] PARADIGM allows complete management of the patient’s personal and insurance information in our efficient single-screen design.
[p] Managing Referrals and authorizations from gatekeepers could not be easier than with PARADIGM’s referral form.
[p] Gone are the days of paper insurance claims and posting remittance checks by hand. Our PARADIGM software provides direct access to the QRS Clearinghouse.
[p] PARADIGM contains a Collections program as an additional tool to help you work slow-paying accounts before you decide to write them off and turn them over to a collection agency.
[p] PARADIGM’s Claim Error Information manager performs many valuable and time-saving functions to help you automatically file clean claims and repair denials.
[p] Filing secondary claims on paper is a thing of the past with line item posting. PARADIGM allows you to disburse payment, adjustment and coordination of benefit information on a charge by charge basis
[p] Appointment Scheduling / Patient Flow
[p] Direct Electronic Claims and Remittance (Blues, Cares, Caids for almost every state)
[p] Insurance Card Scanning
[p] Institutional Billing (UB04)
[p] Medicare Contract Fee Schedules
[p] Practice Specific: (Radiology, Allergy, Anesthesia Billing, Chiropractic, Durable Medical Equipment)
[p] Electronic Work List
[p] HL7 &#8211; Interfaces (Labs, Hospitals, Collection Agencies)
[p] ODBC Connectivity (Crystal Reports, Access, Excel)

Excellent — critical detail: "PARADIGM shares a single database between the EHR and the Practice Management system." Let me get more pages:
[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "# Get the additional solution pages\nfor page in about business-services edi insurance-eligibility payment-processing statements appointment-reminder-service; do\n  echo \"=== $page ===\"\n  curl -sL -k --max-time 10 \"https://www.qrshs.com/$page/\" 2>&1 | python3 -c \"\nimport sys, re\nhtml = sys.stdin.read()\nfor tag in ['h1','h2','h3','h4','p','li']:\n    for m in re.finditer(f'<{tag}[^>]*>(.*?)</{tag}>', html, re.DOTALL|re.IGNORECASE):\n        text = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', '', m.group(1)).strip()\n        if text and len(text) > 15 and len(text) < 500:\n            print(f'[{tag}] {text}')\n\" 2>&1 | head -20\n  echo \"\"\ndone",
  "slow_ok": true
}
[RESULT: === about ===
[h2] Request A Free Demo
[p] Our Software is used by providers across America to streamline their scheduling, charting, imaging, billing, patient engagement, encounter documentation, data security, and more.
[p] We don’t outsource our support. Once you become a customer, you will work directly with our support team based 100% in the U.S.
[p] Our goal is to unburden you from the technical and administrative responsibilities of managing your practice, so you can focus on what matters most—caring for your patients and growing your business.
[p] We are here to improve your practice by installing the best and most efficient software and hardware solutions. Please fill up this form so we can assist you
[p] EHR

[p] PM
				
					
						PM
						
							
							PARADIGM PM
[p] Quality Rep Services, Inc. (QRS) was founded in 1983 by Rusty Dickerson, who is the President of QRS. Initially QRS was founded as a medical equipment manufacturer’s representative. QRS represented several brands of cardiac medical equipment. The letters &#8220;QRS&#8221; are representative of the points on a heart beat wave.

[p] PM
				
					
						PM
						
							
							PARADIGM PM
[p] QRS has operated a claims clearinghouse for over 15 years and clears more than two-million claims per year. Our staff will help you complete any required paperwork to start sending claims fast.
[p] But claims are only half of the story. We also offer Electronic Remittance through our clearinghouse. Posting payments could not be any easier than with the Electronic Remittance software.

=== insurance-eligibility ===
[h1] Insurance Eligibility
[h2] Request A Free Demo
[h2] PARADIGM Verify will help you:
[p] Insurance eligibility verification is a crucial step in managing the financial health of your medical practice. At QRS Healthcare Solutions, our Insurance Eligibility Verification service allows practices to verify patient insurance coverage seamlessly before services are rendered. With our fully integrated solution, you can reduce claim denials, improve patient experience, and save time and money—all while ensuring your practice gets paid for the care provided.
[p] Real-Time Insurance Verification
[p] Our electronic eligibility verification connects your practice to thousands of payers, providing real-time insurance coverage verification before a patient&#8217;s visit. No more waiting on hold or navigating lengthy processes to verify patient information. With electronic insurance verification, you can determine patient eligibility instantly, minimizing administrative burdens and keeping your schedule on track.
[p] Automatic Insurance Eligibility Checks
[p] Our system goes beyond manual checks by automating the insurance eligibility process. The Practice EHR Electronic Eligibility Verification feature automatically runs insurance eligibility checks 24 hours before a patient’s scheduled appointment. This proactive approach ensures your practice&#8217;s financial health by verifying coverage before services are provided, minimizing claim rejections and ensuring smooth billing operations.
[p] We are here to improve your practice by installing the best and most efficient software and hardware solutions. Please fill up this form so we can assist you
[p] EHR
				
					
						EHR
						
							
							PARADIGM EHR
[p] PM

[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "# Check portal page\ncurl -sL -k --max-time 10 \"https://portal.qrshs.com/login\" 2>&1 | python3 -c \"\nimport sys, re\nhtml = sys.stdin.read()\n# Get title and key text\ntitle = re.search(r'<title>(.*?)</title>', html, re.DOTALL|re.IGNORECASE)\nif title: print(f'Title: {title.group(1).strip()}')\nfor tag in ['h1','h2','h3','p']:\n    for m in re.finditer(f'<{tag}[^>]*>(.*?)</{tag}>', html, re.DOTALL|re.IGNORECASE):\n        text = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', '', m.group(1)).strip()\n        if text and len(text) > 5:\n            print(f'[{tag}] {text}')\n\" 2>&1 | head -20"
}

}

[h4] EHR Real World Testing Plan
[p] This Real World Testing Results Report is complete with all required elements, including measures that address all certification criteria and care settings. All information in this document is up to date and fully addresses the health IT developer’s Real World Testing and Real World Test Results Reporting requirements.
[p] This Real World Testing Results Report is complete with all required elements, including measures that address all certification criteria and care settings. All information in this document is up to date and fully addresses the health IT developer’s Real World Testing and Real World Test Results Reporting requirements.
[p] This Real World Testing Results Report is complete with all required elements, including measures that address all certification criteria and care settings. All information in this document is up to date and fully addresses the health IT developer’s Real World Testing and Real World Test Results Reporting requirements.
[p] The PARADIGM® FHIR Data Portability module provides authorized EHR users the ability to export the Electronic Health Information (EHI) of a patient or set of patients. The Electronic Health Information (EHI) is exported in C-CDA and JSON formats. This document provides guidance on the usage of the PARADIGM® FHIR Data Portability module.
[p] This Real World Testing Results Report is complete with all required elements, including measures that address all certification criteria and care settings. All information in this document is up to date and fully addresses the health IT developer’s Real World Testing and Real World Test Results Reporting requirements.
[p] This document contains the PARADIGM® Privacy and Security Transparency Attestations.
[p] The PARADIGM® Patient API provides resources for patient searches to retrieve internal unique identifiers to be used to retrieve data through the PARADIGM® Patient API as a C-CDA or through the PARADIGM® FHIR API set of resources. This document provides guidance on the usage of the PARADIGM® Patient API.
[p] The PARADIGM® FHIR API provides thorough REST-based interoperability of patient health information to developers and software using the HL7® FHIR® standard and the U.S. Core Data for Interoperability (USCDI) data classes and data elements. The document provides guidance on the usage of the PARADIGM® FHIR API.

[TOOL: bash]

  "command": "# Search Google for QRS Inc PARADIGM reviews and info\ncurl -sL -k --max-time 15 \"https://www.google.com/search?q=%22QRS+Inc%22+%22PARADIGM%22+EHR+review\" 2>&1 | python3 -c \"\nimport sys, re\nhtml = sys.stdin.read()\n# Extract search results\nfor m in re.finditer(r'<a[^>]*href=\\\"(/url\\?q=|)(https?://[^\\\"&]+)', html):\n    url = m.group(2)\n    if 'google' not in url and 'gstatic' not in url:\n        print(url)\n\" 2>&1 | head -20"
}

[Subagent is still working (timeout reached). Progress summary:]
The subagent has been attempting to gather third-party information about QRS Inc and PARADIGM EHR from multiple sources (MedicalRecords.com, Crunchbase, SourceForge, Slashdot, topbusinesssoftware.com, and ONC CHPL), but encountered significant roadblocks — most sites blocked access via Cloudflare CAPTCHAs or login walls. [TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "# Get the EHI Export Documentation - this will tell us what data the product stores\ncurl -sL -k --max-time 20 -o /tmp/ehi-doc.pdf \"https://www.qrshs.info/rwtp/PARADIGM%20EHI%20Export%20Documentation.pdf\"\npython3 -c \"\nimport subprocess\nresult = subprocess.run(['pdftotext', '/tmp/ehi-doc.pdf', '-'], capture_output=True, text=True)\nprint(result.stdout[:5000])\n\"",
  "slow_ok": true
}
[RESULT: PARADIGM® ELECTRONIC HEALTH INFORMATION (EHI) EXPORT DOCUMENTATION

The PARADIGM® FHIR Data Portability module provides authorized EHR users the ability to
export the Electronic Health Information (EHI) of a patient or set of patients.
The Electronic Health Information (EHI) is exported in C-CDA and JSON formats.
This document provides guidance on the usage of the PARADIGM® FHIR Data Portability
module.

Table of Contents
Terms and Conditions ................................................................................................................................. 2
Export Details and Directory …….................................................................................................................. 5
Usage .......................................................................................................................................................... 5
Patient Search ............................................................................................................................................. 5
Patient C-CDA .............................................................................................................................................. 6

ehi_export_docv1.0

Page 1 of 6

PARADIGM® ELECTRONIC HEALTH INFORMATION (EHI) EXPORT DOCUMENTATION

Terms and Conditions
These Terms of Use ("Terms") govern your access to and use of any and all PARADIGM® APIs and related
documentation, services, etc. By accessing or using a Certified PARADIGM® API, you agree to be bound by these Terms.
“Certified PARADIGM® API” means any API provided by QRS, Inc. to allow development of consumer-facing (i.e., patient,
a patient’s authorized representative, physician, practice, etc.) applications only. You represent and warrant that you are
at least 18 years of age and that you possess the legal right and ability to agree to these Terms and to use Certified
PARADIGM® APIs in accordance with these Terms.

Developer Account and Registration
 Developer Account. In order to establish a Developer Account, you will be required to provide contact
information, organizational details, billing details, and other information, and you agree to keep the information
updated at all times. Developer accounts may only be registered through direct consultation and permission of a
QRS Client.

Representations and Responsibilities
 Entity Representation. If you are using a Certified PARADIGM® API on behalf of a legal entity (i.e., an App
company), you represent that you have proper authority to act on behalf of and bind the entity to these Terms,
and by accepting, you accept on behalf of the entity (and all references to “you” in the Terms refer to the
entity).
 Compliance. You agree to be financially responsible for your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs and to comply
with your responsibilities and obligations as stated in these Terms. You agree to comply at all times with all
applicable laws, rules and regulations relating to the use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs, the QRS, Inc. websites
and the development, distribution, commercialization and use of your App. You further acknowledge and agree
that you are not a supplier or downstream business associate (as defined under the Health Insurance Portability
and Accountability Act of 1996 (as amended) of QRS, Inc. You hereby grant QRS, Inc. the right to monitor and
periodically audit in a reasonable manner your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs, your App and other activities
related to your obligations under these Terms.
 Responsibilities. You represent and warrant that your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs in a QRS, Inc. client’s
environment will comply with the following: A. Each consuming App will be whitelisted by QRS, Inc. as meeting
the applicable technical specifications through QRS, Inc.’s application validation process; B. Each validated App
will be approved and registered for use by the applicable QRS, Inc. client prior to implementation within such
client’s environment; and C. You have properly licensed and implemented your App to the applicable QRS, Inc.
client under a dually-executed agreement with such client.
 Virus Warranty. You warrant that your Apps will not contain any viruses or other malicious computer
instructions, devices, or techniques that can or were designed to threaten, infect, damage, disable, or shut down
the Certified PARADIGM® APIs, any technology, software, solution, equipment or any computer system
 Open-Source. You warrant that your Apps do not contain any open-source software licensed under terms that
require the user to make (a) the user’s modifications to the open source freely available in source code form, or
(b) any software that the user “combines” with the open-source software freely available in source code form.

General
 Changes. QRS, Inc. may, in its sole and absolute discretion, make changes, modifications or updates to Certified
PARADIGM® APIs (including without limitation changes to the capabilities and tech specs), the App Registration
and Validation Process or any portion of its websites without notice to you. In addition, QRS, Inc. may withdraw,
suspend or discontinue any functionality or feature of Certified PARADIGM® APIs at any time; provided,
however, that if your dually-executed agreement with QRS, Inc. provides for the continued use of any
functionality or feature, QRS, Inc. will continue to provide that respective functionality or feature to you subject
to the provisions of such dually-executed agreement.
 Global Availability. QRS, Inc. makes no representations that Certified PARADIGM® APIs are appropriate or
available for use in locations outside of the United States, and access to them from such territories is at your
own risk. Those who choose to access Certified PARADIGM® APIs from locations outside of the United States do
so at their own initiative and are responsible for compliance with applicable local laws.

Inc.’s software, products and services are proprietary in nature, that QRS, Inc. claims all intellectual property
rights therein as well as in all modifications, enhancements and alterations thereto, and that QRS, Inc. neither
grants nor otherwise transfers any rights of ownership therein to you or any third party. No rights or licenses are
granted by QRS, Inc. other than those rights expressly granted in these Terms, and QRS, Inc. reserves all rights
not expressly granted.

time, with or without cause, upon notice. QRS, Inc. also reserves the right to disable your App in a production
environment at any time, with or without cause. QRS, Inc. reserves the right to remove your App from the QRS,
Inc. whitelist if your App poses any security, privacy, or patient safety risks. The provisions concerning
Indemnification, Waiver, Release and Limitation of Liability, and General shall survive any termination of these
Terms.

Page 4 of 6

PARADIGM® ELECTRONIC HEALTH INFORMATION (EHI) EXPORT DOCUMENTATION
 Venue, Governing Law. This Agreement is governed by US federal law or the laws of the State of Tennessee. You
hereby consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of courts in Knox County, Tennessee, U.S.A. in all disputes
arising out of or relating to the use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs. Use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs is
unauthorized in any jurisdiction that does not give effect to all provisions of these Terms, including without
limitation this paragraph. Any cause of action or claim you may have with respect to QRS, Inc. must be
commenced within one (1) year after the claim or cause of action arises. QRS, Inc.’s failure to insist upon or
enforce strict performance of any provision of these Terms shall not be construed as a waiver of any provision or
right. Neither the course of conduct between the parties nor trade practice shall act to modify any provision of
these Terms.

Export Details and Directory
Data is exported in a zip format (.zip) and contains standard CCDA (.xml) as well as other available information for each
patient included. Additional information is included in a JSON (.json) while information imported into the EHR will be
included in the format in which it was received (ex PDF/PNG/etc).
The CCDA will be titled by the patient code, 10000.xml for example. Any additional information will be titled by the
information name and appended to the patient code, 10000_invoice history.json for example. Any files imported into
the EHR, if present, will be included in a directory _addt_files appended to the patient code, 10000_addt_files for
example.

Usage
The Data Portability module is reachable through the EHR System Reports by authorized users only. To include all
available EHI, click the “include all Electronic Healthcare Information (EHI) for each patient in the set” checkbox.

Patient Search
Patient search is used to identify the unique patient code used to retrieve patient data. Sufficient information must be
provided to uniquely identify a patient and at least one of the request parameters must be included.
Request: GET https://api.qrshs.com/v1/patient/search
 Request Headers
Name

Type

Required

Description

Authorization

Basic

required

Client ID and secret

 Request Parameters
Name

Type

Required

Description

first_name
mid_name
last_name
birthdate

string
string
string
date

conditional
conditional
conditional
conditional

First name
Middle name
Last name
Date of birth

ehi_export_docv1.0

Page 5 of 6

PARADIGM® ELECTRONIC HEALTH INFORMATION (EHI) EXPORT DOCUMENTATION
ssn

string

conditional

Social Security Number

JSON Response Parameters:
Name

Type

Example

patient

string

“10006-111-20180823”

Error Messages:
Message

Description

auth_failure
no_criteria
non_unique_return
not_found

Authentication failure
At least one request parameter must be included
More than one patient identified, search must be refined
No patient found matching search criteria

Patient C-CDA
Patient C-is used to retrieve a C-CDA CCD document for a given patient. The return is an XML document unless an error
is encountered, in which case the return will be in JSON format.
Request: GET https://api.qrshs.com/v1/patient/ccda
 Request Headers
Name

Type

Required

Description

Authorization

Basic

required

Client ID and secret

 Request Parameters
Name

Type

Required

Description

patient
date
start_date
end_date

string
date
date
date

required
optional
optional
optional

Unique patient identifier
Exact date of data to retrieve
Start of date range for data
End of date range for data

Error Messages:
Message

Description

auth_failure
no_patient
bad_date

Authentication failure
A valid patient code is required
Invalid date format – should be DDMMYYYY

15.04.04.2838.PARA.22.01.1.221227
https://www.qrshs.info

Summary of Testing Methods and Key Findings
Methodologies utilized during testing included data log files, polling, various scenario tests, and
visual inspection in our Sandbox – Virtualized Environment as laid out in our Real World Testing
Plan.
In accordance with the ONC’s Enforcement Discretion Notice, QRS is only required to submit
RWT Results for the criteria 170.315(g)(7), 170.315(g)(9).

Standards Updates (Including Standards Version Advancement Process
(SVAP) and United States Core Data for Interoperability (USCDII)
None of our products include these voluntary standards.

Care Setting(s)
PARADIGM® EHR is principally marketed to healthcare providers in ambulatory care settings.
Accordingly, our testing occurred in the ambulatory setting only.
We tested a minimum of three client practices. The number of client testing participants
included varied for each criterion/measure as not all have the same usage needs or perform the
same activities in their respective specialty settings.
In settings where functionality was not widely used, we utilized our sandbox environment for
testing solely when needed, or in addition to client sites.

Page 1 of 4

2025 REAL WORLD TESTING RESULTS

Applicable Certification Criteria
This results report includes real world testing measurements/metrics for the following criteria:
• 170.315(g)(7) - Application access – patient selection
• 170.315(g)(9) - Application access – all data request
• 170.315(g)(10) - Standardized API for patient and population services

Metrics and Outcomes
Correctly identify a Patient based on query parameters
Associated Certification Criteria
170.315(g)(7) - Application access — patient selection
Measurement/Metric
Correctly identify a Patient based on query parameters
• Number of successful API requests
• Number of API request errors
• Rate of API request errors
Testing Method(s)/Methodology(ies) Sandbox - Virtualized environment
Relied Upon Software
N/A
Expected Outcomes
The API request will return a C-CDA R2.1 Validated CCD
containing requests for patient data for specified dates
and/or within specified date range(s).
Maximum of 4% error rate for API requests over a threemonth period.
Actual Outcomes
Tested in virtualized environment with a fixed number
of requests (10). There were no error messages
encountered in the controlled environment, therefore,
the reported success rate was 100%.

[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "# Get the FHIR API documentation for insight into data stored\ncurl -sL -k --max-time 20 -o /tmp/fhir-api.pdf \"https://www.qrshs.info/rwtp/PARADIGM%20FHIR%20API%20Documentation.pdf\"\npython3 -c \"\nimport subprocess\nresult = subprocess.run(['pdftotext', '/tmp/fhir-api.pdf', '-'], capture_output=True, text=True)\nprint(result.stdout[:8000])\n\"",

[RESULT: PARADIGM® FHIR API DOCUMENTATION

The PARADIGM® FHIR API provides thorough REST-based interoperability of patient health
information to developers and software using the HL7® FHIR® standard and the U.S. Core Data
for Interoperability (USCDI) data classes and data elements.
This document provides guidance on the usage of the PARADIGM® FHIR API.

Table of Contents
Terms and Conditions ....................................................................................................................................... 2
Authentication .................................................................................................................................................. 5
Request Structure ............................................................................................................................................. 7
FHIR Resources.................................................................................................................................................. 7
Error and Exceptions ....................................................................................................................................... 27
Software Requirements .................................................................................................................................. 27

fhir_api_doc

Page 1 of 27

PARADIGM® FHIR API DOCUMENTATION

Terms and Conditions
These Terms of Use ("Terms") govern your access to and use of any and all PARADIGM® APIs and related
documentation, services, etc. By accessing or using a Certified PARADIGM® API, you agree to be bound by these Terms.
“Certified PARADIGM® API” means any API provided by QRS, Inc. to allow development of consumer-facing (i.e., patient,
a patient’s authorized representative, physician, practice, etc.) applications only. You represent and warrant that you are
at least 18 years of age and that you possess the legal right and ability to agree to these Terms and to use Certified
PARADIGM® APIs in accordance with these Terms.

Developer Account and Registration
 Developer Account. In order to establish a Developer Account, you will be required to provide contact
information, organizational details, billing details, and other information, and you agree to keep the information
updated at all times. Developer accounts may only be registered through direct consultation and permission of a
QRS Client.

Representations and Responsibilities
 Entity Representation. If you are using a Certified PARADIGM® API on behalf of a legal entity (i.e., an App
company), you represent that you have proper authority to act on behalf of and bind the entity to these Terms,
and by accepting, you accept on behalf of the entity (and all references to “you” in the Terms refer to the
entity).
 Compliance. You agree to be financially responsible for your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs and to comply
with your responsibilities and obligations as stated in these Terms. You agree to comply at all times with all
applicable laws, rules and regulations relating to the use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs, the QRS, Inc. websites
and the development, distribution, commercialization and use of your App. You further acknowledge and agree
that you are not a supplier or downstream business associate (as defined under the Health Insurance Portability
and Accountability Act of 1996 (as amended) of QRS, Inc. You hereby grant QRS, Inc. the right to monitor and
periodically audit in a reasonable manner your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs, your App and other activities
related to your obligations under these Terms.
 Responsibilities. You represent and warrant that your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs in a QRS, Inc. client’s
environment will comply with the following: A. Each consuming App will be whitelisted by QRS, Inc. as meeting
the applicable technical specifications through QRS, Inc.’s application validation process; B. Each validated App
will be approved and registered for use by the applicable QRS, Inc. client prior to implementation within such
client’s environment; and C. You have properly licensed and implemented your App to the applicable QRS, Inc.
client under a dually-executed agreement with such client.
 Virus Warranty. You warrant that your Apps will not contain any viruses or other malicious computer
instructions, devices, or techniques that can or were designed to threaten, infect, damage, disable, or shut down
the Certified PARADIGM® APIs, any technology, software, solution, equipment or any computer system
 Open-Source. You warrant that your Apps do not contain any open-source software licensed under terms that
require the user to make (a) the user’s modifications to the open source freely available in source code form, or
(b) any software that the user “combines” with the open-source software freely available in source code form.

grants nor otherwise transfers any rights of ownership th

[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "python3 -c \"\nimport subprocess\nresult = subprocess.run(['pdftotext', '/tmp/fhir-api.pdf', '-'], capture_output=True, text=True)\n# Skip the T&C and get to the FHIR resources\ntext = result.stdout\nidx = text.find('FHIR Resources')\nprint(text[idx:idx+8000])\n\""
}
[RESULT: FHIR Resources.................................................................................................................................................. 7

fhir_api_doc

Page 1 of 27

PARADIGM® FHIR API DOCUMENTATION

Terms and Conditions
These Terms of Use ("Terms") govern your access to and use of any and all PARADIGM® APIs and related
documentation, services, etc. By accessing or using a Certified PARADIGM® API, you agree to be bound by these Terms.
“Certified PARADIGM® API” means any API provided by QRS, Inc. to allow development of consumer-facing (i.e., patient,
a patient’s authorized representative, physician, practice, etc.) applications only. You represent and warrant that you are
at least 18 years of age and that you possess the legal right and ability to agree to these Terms and to use Certified
PARADIGM® APIs in accordance with these Terms.

Developer Account and Registration
 Developer Account. In order to establish a Developer Account, you will be required to provide contact
information, organizational details, billing details, and other information, and you agree to keep the information
updated at all times. Developer accounts may only be registered through direct consultation and permission of a
QRS Client.

Representations and Responsibilities
 Entity Representation. If you are using a Certified PARADIGM® API on behalf of a legal entity (i.e., an App
company), you represent that you have proper authority to act on behalf of and bind the entity to these Terms,
and by accepting, you accept on behalf of the entity (and all references to “you” in the Terms refer to the
entity).
 Compliance. You agree to be financially responsible for your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs and to comply
with your responsibilities and obligations as stated in these Terms. You agree to comply at all times with all
applicable laws, rules and regulations relating to the use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs, the QRS, Inc. websites
and the development, distribution, commercialization and use of your App. You further acknowledge and agree
that you are not a supplier or downstream business associate (as defined under the Health Insurance Portability
and Accountability Act of 1996 (as amended) of QRS, Inc. You hereby grant QRS, Inc. the right to monitor and
periodically audit in a reasonable manner your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs, your App and other activities
related to your obligations under these Terms.
 Responsibilities. You represent and warrant that your use of Certified PARADIGM® APIs in a QRS, Inc. client’s
environment will comply with the following: A. Each consuming App will be whitelisted by QRS, Inc. as meeting
the applicable technical specifications through QRS, Inc.’s application validation process; B. Each validated App
will be approved and registered for use by the applicable QRS, Inc. client prior to implementation within such
client’s environment; and C. You have properly licensed and implemented your App to the applicable QRS, Inc.
client under a dually-executed agreement with such client.
 Virus Warranty. You warrant that your Apps will not contain any viruses or other malicious computer
instructions, devices, or techniques that can or were designed to threaten, infect, damage, disable, or shut down
the Certified PARADIGM® APIs, any technology, software, solution, equipment or any computer system
 Open-Source. You warrant that your Apps do not contain any open-source software licensed under terms that
require the user to make (a) the user’s modifications to the open source freely available in source code form, or
(b) any software that the user “combines” with the open-source software freely available in source code form.

fhir_api_doc

Page 2 of 27

PARADIGM® FHIR API DOCUMENTATION
 App Distribution. You are solely responsible for the demonstration, pricing, sales support (including product
analyst support), licensing (via a written agreement with the QRS, Inc. client), configuration, installation,
implementation, maintenance and technical support of your Apps.

PARADIGM® APIs (including without limitation changes to the capabilities and tech specs), the App Registration
and Validation Process or any portion of its websites without notice to you. In addition, QRS, Inc. may withdraw,
suspend or discontinue any functionality or feature of Certified PARADIGM® APIs at any time; provided,
however, that if your dually-executed agreement with QRS, Inc. provides for the continued use of any
functionality or feature, QRS, Inc. will continue to provide that respective functionality or feature to you subject
to the provisions of such dually-executed agreement.

available for use in locations outside of the United States, and access to them from such territories is at your

so at their own initiative and are responsible for compliance with applicable local laws.

[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "python3 -c \"\nimport subprocess\nresult = subprocess.run(['pdftotext', '/tmp/fhir-api.pdf', '-'], capture_output=True, text=True)\ntext = result.stdout\n# Find the FHIR Resources section content\nidx = text.find('FHIR Resources\\n')\nif idx == -1:\n    # Try another pattern\n    for i, line in enumerate(text.split('\\n')):\n        if 'FHIR Resources' in line and 'Table of Contents' not in text[max(0,text.find(line)-200):text.find(line)]:\n            idx = text.find(line)\n            break\nprint(f'Found at index: {idx}')\n# Print from page 7 onward\npages = text.split('Page ')\nfor i, page in enumerate(pages):\n    if page.startswith('7 of') or page.startswith('6 of') or page.startswith('8 of'):\n        print(f'--- Page marker found at segment {i} ---')\n        # Print this and subsequent pages\n        remaining = 'Page '.join(pages[i:])\n        print(remaining[:8000])\n        break\n\""
}
[RESULT: Found at index: 18300
--- Page marker found at segment 6 ---
6 of 27

PARADIGM® FHIR API DOCUMENTATION
 Request Parameters
Name

Type

Required

Description

grant_type
refresh_token

string
string

required
required

Fixed value: ‘refresh_token’
Refresh token from the previous access token request

Response Parameters:
Same parameters as Access Token returns.

Request Structure
The basic request structure is formatted as the following:
Request: GET [base]/[resource]/[parameters]





The base is the API URL https://api.qrshs.com/fhir
The resource is the FHIR resource name, such as Patient or Observation
The parameters are the id and search criteria, such as id=04222022 or name=Barbara
Request Headers
Name

Type

Required

Description

Authorization

Bearer

required

Access token from authentication

Interactions are limited to Read (GET) access only. Available FHIR resources and their formats are listed below. For more
information on FHIR and it’s intended request structure, please visit http://hl7.org/fhir/http.html.

FHIR Resources
Patient
Query Patient for a patient selection and demographic information. For more information on this resource please refer
to the US Core Patient Profile.
Request: GET [base]/Patient{parameters}
 Example: https://api.qrshs.com/fhir/Patient?id=10006
 Request Parameters

Good — I can see the FHIR resources. Let me get the full list:
[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "python3 -c \"\nimport subprocess\nresult = subprocess.run(['pdftotext', '/tmp/fhir-api.pdf', '-'], capture_output=True, text=True)\ntext = result.stdout\n# Find all FHIR resource headers - they appear as standalone resource names\nimport re\nresources = re.findall(r'\\n([A-Z][a-zA-Z]+)\\nQuery \\w+', text)\nprint('FHIR Resources found:')\nfor r in resources:\n    print(f'  - {r}')\nprint()\n# Also find all 'Request: GET' lines for resource endpoints\nendpoints = re.findall(r'Request: GET \\[base\\]/(\\w+)', text)\nprint('Resource endpoints:')\nfor e in set(endpoints):\n    print(f'  - {e}')\n\""
}

[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "# Check LinkedIn or similar for company info\ncurl -sL -k --max-time 15 -H \"User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36\" \"https://www.linkedin.com/company/qrs-inc\" 2>&1 | python3 -c \"\nimport sys, re\nhtml = sys.stdin.read()\ntitle = re.search(r'<title>(.*?)</title>', html, re.DOTALL|re.IGNORECASE)\nif title: print(f'Title: {title.group(1).strip()}')\n# Find description meta\ndesc = re.search(r'<meta[^>]*name=[\\\"']description[\\\"'][^>]*content=[\\\"](.*?)[\\\"]', html, re.IGNORECASE)\nif desc: print(f'Description: {desc.group(1)[:500]}')\n\" 2>&1"
}

id="gam-square-tile-2"></div></div><div class="card stack"><h2 class="bds-h5">Accreditation and Ratings Overview</h2><div class="stack" Business" height="34px" width="80px"/></a></div><div class="not-sidebar"><p>Select businesses earn BBB Accreditation by undergoing a thorough evaluation and upholding the BBB Accreditation Standards.</p></div></div><div class="with-sidebar gutter-15 dtm-search-rating-key"><div class="sidebar"><a aria-label="Overview of BBB ratings" href="https://www.bbb.org/overview-of-bbb-ratings" rel="noreferrer" target="_blank" style="text-decoration:none"><span class="letter-grade bg-gray-40 leading-1 text-blue-brand" style="--vertical-offset:0.02em;font-size:var(--bds-font-size-80)"><span><span class="font-bold">A</span>+</span><span class="visually-hidden">BBB rating</span></span></a></div><div class="not-sidebar"><p>BBB assigns ratings from A+ (highest) to F (lowest). In some cases, BBB will not rate the business (indicated by an NR, or &quot;No Rating&quot;) for reasons that include insufficient information about a business or ongoing review/update of the business&#x27;s file.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="card stack bg-blue-medium-5"><h2 class="bds-h3 font-bold text-blue-medium">Didn&#x27;t find the business you were looking for?</h2><p style="--stack-space:0.5rem">If the business you&#x27;re looking for isn&#x27;t in our directory, submit a request to have it added.</p><div><a class="bds-cta" href="/get-listed">Request a Business</a></div></div></div></div></div></div></main><script src="/TerminusContent/bbb/dist/search.runtime.4b827aabb2837e6b453c.js" async=""></script><script src="/TerminusContent/bbb/dist/search.main.d9d6a373f661d385863c.js" async=""></script></div>

No BBB or OpenCorporates results. I have enough now. Let me also check the specialty mentions from the PM page and look at the certification criteria more carefully:
[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "# Check the patient portal page (index-5.html)\ncurl -sL -k --max-time 10 \"https://www.qrshs.info/index-5.html\" 2>&1 | python3 -c \"\nimport sys, re\nhtml = sys.stdin.read()\nfor tag in ['h1','h2','h3','h4','p','li','a']:\n    for m in re.finditer(f'<{tag}[^>]*>(.*?)</{tag}>', html, re.DOTALL|re.IGNORECASE):\n        text = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', '', m.group(1)).strip()\n        if text and len(text) > 10 and len(text) < 500:\n            print(f'[{tag}] {text}')\n\" 2>&1 | head -30"
}
[RESULT: [h1] 404 Not Found
]
Now I have comprehensive information. Let me write the reports:
[TOOL: bash]
{
  "command": "mkdir -p /home/exedev/ehi-export-analysis/results/qrs-inc"
}

[TOOL: patch]
{
  "path": "/home/exedev/ehi-export-analysis/results/qrs-inc/product-research.md",
  "patches": [
    {
      "operation": "overwrite",
      "newText": "# QRS, Inc. — Product Research\n\nResearched: 2025-07-14\nDeveloper website: https://qrshs.com/\n\n## Overview\n\nQRS, Inc. (\"Quality Rep Services\") is a small, privately held medical software company founded in 1983, headquartered in Knoxville, Tennessee (2010 Castaic Lane, Knoxville, TN 37932). The company was founded by Rusty Dickerson (still President) originally as a manufacturer's representative for cardiac medical equipment — the name \"QRS\" references the points on a heartbeat wave (ECG). The company transitioned into medical practice management and EHR software.\n\nQRS is a very small vendor serving ambulatory medical practices across the United States. The company emphasizes long-standing customer relationships (testimonials reference 13–15+ year relationships), U.S.-based support, and a \"turnkey\" approach that bundles software, hardware, networking, data conversion, and ongoing support. They also operate their own claims clearinghouse, clearing \"more than two million claims per year.\" The company does not disclose customer counts or revenue. There is no BBB listing, no G2 or Capterra presence, and very limited third-party coverage — consistent with a very small, niche vendor. Their SSL certificate was expired at time of research (qrshs.com), though the site was functional.\n\n## Product: PARADIGM®\n\nCHPL ID: 15.04.04.2838.PARA.22.01.1.221227 (CHPL listing 11142)\n\n### What It Is\n\nPARADIGM is an integrated EHR and practice management (PM) system for ambulatory medical practices. A critical architectural detail from the vendor's own website: \"PARADIGM was designed as a single product with all the benefits of an EHR and Practice Management system. It is not a cobbled together system built from systems that were acquired by purchasing other companies. PARADIGM shares a single database between the EHR and the Practice Management system.\" This means clinical and billing/administrative data live in one unified database.\n\nThe certified module (PARADIGM® version 22) covers both the EHR and PM capabilities. The CHPL certification spans a broad set of criteria: clinical data ((a)(2), (a)(3), (a)(5), (a)(12), (a)(14)), transitions of care ((b)(1), (b)(2), (b)(7), (b)(8), (b)(10), (b)(11)), patient portal/VDT ((e)(1), (e)(3)), clinical quality measures ((c)(1), (c)(2), (c)(3)), public health reporting ((f)(1), (f)(2), (f)(5)), and API/FHIR access ((g)(2)–(g)(7), (g)(9), (g)(10)). This is a comprehensive certification covering 39 criteria — indicative of a full-featured ambulatory EHR+PM.\n\n### Users & Market\n\nPARADIGM is marketed to healthcare providers in ambulatory care settings. Per the Real World Testing results: \"PARADIGM® EHR is principally marketed to healthcare providers in ambulatory care settings.\" The vendor's about page says: \"Our Software is used by providers across America to streamline their scheduling, charting, imaging, billing, patient engagement, encounter documentation, data security, and more.\"\n\nTarget specialties are broad. The PM page specifically mentions specialty-specific modules for: Radiology, Allergy, Anesthesia Billing, Chiropractic, and Durable Medical Equipment. Customer testimonials come from billing service operators and multi-provider practices. One testimonial references opening a medical billing service and choosing Paradigm for it, suggesting the product is also used by third-party billing companies.\n\nNo customer count or install base data is publicly available. The vendor appears to serve primarily small to mid-size medical practices and billing services. The 2025 RWT report mentions testing with \"a minimum of three client practices\" and notes that \"many client practices did not regularly utilize Direct Messaging to share clinical data\" — suggesting a relatively small, low-complexity customer base.\n\n### Modules & Functionality\n\nBased on the vendor's website feature descriptions:\n\n**PARADIGM EHR** (from qrshs.com/paradigm-ehr/):\n- **Patient Flow**: View of the day's schedule with color-coded status (checked in, in care, fee slip created, checked out)\n- **Custom Chart Layout**: Customizable chart tab configuration for organizing and storing patient information\n- **Speech Recognition**: Supports speech-to-text for data entry into forms\n- **Voice File Storage**: Can store .wav voice files attached to specific encounters\n- **Note Generation**: Generates comprehensive final summary notes per encounter; customizable to include specific clinical areas\n- **Prescriptions**: Issue prescriptions, refill existing prescriptions, enter historical medication information; auto-files to medications section of chart\n- **Recall/Follow-ups**: Enter recall or follow-up appointments that automatically integrate with the scheduling system\n- **Scanning**: Supports TIF, PDF, JPG file scanning into patient charts; described as key for paper chart elimination\n- **Patient Search**: Database search functionality\n- **Dynamic Fee Slip**: (listed as module; details not elaborated on the EHR page)\n- **Electronic Work Lists**: Described as going beyond standard management reports\n- **HL7 Interfaces**: Connects to labs, hospitals, and collection agencies\n\n**PARADIGM PM** (from qrshs.com/paradigm-pm/):\n- **Appointment Scheduling / Patient Flow**: Integrated scheduling\n- **Claims Scrubbing**: Automated claim cleaning before submission\n- **Insurance Contract Management**: Consolidated management of multiple insurance plans under common contracts\n- **Claims Tracking**: View all claim types (printed and electronic) via Claims Manager\n- **Patient Management**: Single-screen management of patient personal and insurance information\n- **Referral Management**: Referral and authorization management from gatekeepers\n- **Electronic Claims**: Direct access to QRS Clearinghouse for electronic claim submission\n- **Electronic Remittance**: Electronic remittance advice posting\n- **Collections**: Built-in collections program for working slow-paying accounts before write-off\n- **Claims Error Information Management**: Auto-filing clean claims and repairing denials\n- **Line Item Posting**: Charge-by-charge disbursement of payment, adjustment, and coordination of benefits; supports secondary claim filing\n- **Charge/Payment/Adjustment Posting**: Single-screen concept for posting charges, payments, adjustments, plus messages and notes to encounters\n- **Refund Management**: Refund program with check printing capability\n- **Management Reporting**: Standard and custom reports\n- **Institutional Billing (UB04)**: Supports facility billing\n- **Insurance Card Scanning**: Scan insurance cards\n- **Medicare Contract Fee Schedules**: Built-in Medicare fee schedules\n- **Specialty-specific modules**: Radiology, Allergy, Anesthesia Billing, Chiropractic, Durable Medical Equipment\n- **ODBC Connectivity**: Supports Crystal Reports, Access, Excel for custom reporting\n- **HL7 Interfaces**: Labs, hospitals, collection agencies\n\n**Additional Services & Integrations** (from various qrshs.com pages):\n- **QRS Clearinghouse**: Vendor-operated clearinghouse clearing 2M+ claims/year; provides both claims submission and electronic remittance\n- **EDI (Electronic Data Interchange)**: Direct electronic claims and remittance for Blues, Medicare, Medicaid across \"almost every state\"\n- **Insurance Eligibility Verification (PARADIGM Verify)**: Real-time electronic eligibility checks connecting to thousands of payers; automated checks 24 hours before scheduled appointments. (Note: the eligibility page oddly references \"Practice EHR\" in one paragraph — possibly copied content from another product or a white-label relationship, though more likely just a web content error.)\n- **Payment Processing**: Integrated merchant services that post directly to billing software and patient accounts; HIPAA-compliant\n- **Electronic Statements**: Outsourced statement printing/mailing services\n- **Appointment Reminder Service (PARADIGM ARS)**: Automated appointment reminders via messaging\n- **Patient Portal**: portal.qrshs.com — login page exists; certified for (e)(1) patient view/download/transmit\n- **FHIR API**: REST-based FHIR R4 API at api.qrshs.com supporting US Core resources\n- **Patient API**: Separate API for patient search and C-CDA retrieval\n- **Data Conversion**: Converts data from other PM systems into PARADIGM\n- **Disaster Recovery**: Automated daily backup to QRS office in Knoxville with secondary offsite backup\n- **Network Services**: Full networking services\n- **Hardware Services**: Hardware sales, installation, and repair\n- **Custom Programming**: Custom reports, data conversions, interfaces, custom forms & scripting\n\n### Data & Content\n\nBased on the unified single-database architecture and the features described above, PARADIGM stores:\n\n**Clinical data** (evidenced by EHR features and FHIR API resources):\n- Patient demographics (name, DOB, SSN, gender, race, ethnicity, language, address, phone — per FHIR Patient resource)\n- Allergies and intolerances (per FHIR AllergyIntolerance resource and EHR features)\n- Conditions/problems (per FHIR Condition resource)\n- Medications and prescriptions (per FHIR MedicationRequest and EHR prescription module)\n- Immunizations (per FHIR Immunization resource)\n- Procedures (per FHIR Procedure resource)\n- Vital signs and lab results (per FHIR Observation resource)\n- Diagnostic reports (per FHIR DiagnosticReport resource)\n- Care plans and assessments (per FHIR CarePlan resource)\n- Care team members (per FHIR CareTeam resource)\n- Goals (per FHIR Goal resource)\n- Implantable devices (per FHIR Device resource)\n- Encounter records (per FHIR Encounter resource)\n- Clinical documents and notes — encounter summary notes (per FHIR DocumentReference and note generation features)\n- Scanned documents (TIF, PDF, JPG files stored in patient charts)\n- Voice recordings (.wav files attached to encounters)\n- Provenance tracking (per FHIR Provenance resource)\n\n**Administrative/billing data** (evidenced by PM features):\n- Appointment scheduling data (including patient flow status)\n- Insurance information and eligibility verification results\n- Claims data (professional and institutional/UB04)\n- Claim scrubbing and error information\n- Payment, adjustment, and refund records (line-item level)\n- Electronic remittance advice\n- Insurance contract terms and fee schedules\n- Referrals and authorizations\n- Collection account data\n- Patient statements\n- Management reports\n\n**EHI Export format** (from EHI Export Documentation):\n- Export is via the \"FHIR Data Portability\" module, accessible through EHR System Reports\n- Output is a ZIP file containing: standard C-CDA R2.1 XML per patient, additional data in JSON format (e.g., \"invoice history\"), and any files imported into the EHR in their original format (PDF, PNG, etc.) in a `_addt_files` directory\n- There is a checkbox to \"include all Electronic Healthcare Information (EHI) for each patient in the set\"\n- The mention of \"invoice history\" as a JSON export suggests billing/financial data is included in the EHI export\n\n**Notable gaps/uncertainties:**\n- The insurance eligibility page references \"Practice EHR\" in one paragraph, which is a different certified EHR product by a different vendor. This could be a web content error, or could hint at shared technology or white-labeling. However, the PARADIGM product has its own independent CHPL certification and distinct APIs, so this appears to be a copy-paste web error.\n- No mention of secure messaging between providers and patients (Direct messaging noted as not widely used by customers in RWT results)\n- No explicit mention of patient portal messaging capabilities (though portal exists)\n- The vendor does not disclose customer count or market share\n- The website's SSL certificate was expired, suggesting limited IT resources for their web presence\n- Real World Testing was conducted primarily in sandbox/virtualized environments with small sample sizes (10 requests), not at scale in production — consistent with a very small vendor with limited API adoption\n\n---\n\n## Summary Assessment\n\nPARADIGM is a small-vendor, full-featured ambulatory EHR+PM system with a unified database architecture. Its single-database design means the EHI export scope should encompass both clinical and billing/financial data. The vendor operates their own clearinghouse and provides a vertically integrated suite of services (software, hardware, networking, support, clearinghouse). The product serves small ambulatory practices and billing services, with specialty support for radiology, allergy, anesthesia, chiropractic, and DME billing. Despite its small market presence, the product has comprehensive ONC certification covering 39 criteria.\n"
    }
  ]
}
[RESULT: <patches_applied>all</patches_applied>
]

Software used by providers across America for scheduling, charting, imaging, billing, patient engagement, encounter documentation\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.com/edi/\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-website\",\n      \"note\": \"EDI page — QRS operates own clearinghouse for 15+ years, clears 2M+ claims/year. Electronic claims and electronic remittance\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.com/insurance-eligibility/\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-website\",\n      \"note\": \"Insurance eligibility page — real-time verification, automated 24hr pre-appointment checks. Note: one paragraph oddly references 'Practice EHR' (different vendor's product name) — likely copy-paste web error\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.com/payment-processing/\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-website\",\n      \"note\": \"Payment processing — integrated merchant services posting directly to billing software and patient accounts, HIPAA compliant\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.com/statements/\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-website\",\n      \"note\": \"Electronic statement services for outsourced printing/mailing\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.com/appointment-reminder-service/\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-website\",\n      \"note\": \"PARADIGM ARS — automated appointment reminders, fully integrated\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.com/business-services/\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-website\",\n      \"note\": \"Business services page — email encryption, threat protection, information archiving, secure file share, cloud backup\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.info\",\n      \"type\": \"mandatory-disclosures\",\n      \"note\": \"ONC disclosures page — links to EHI export docs, FHIR API docs, Patient API docs, RWT plans/results, privacy attestations. No mandatory_disclosures_url was provided in CHPL metadata (field was empty), but this URL serves that purpose\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.info/rwtp/PARADIGM%20EHI%20Export%20Documentation.pdf\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-documentation\",\n      \"note\": \"EHI Export Documentation (6 pages) — export via FHIR Data Portability module, ZIP format with C-CDA XML + JSON (including 'invoice history') + imported files. API at api.qrshs.com. Patient search by name, DOB, SSN\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.info/rwtp/PARADIGM%20FHIR%20API%20Documentation.pdf\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-documentation\",\n      \"note\": \"FHIR API Documentation (27 pages) — 15 FHIR resources: Patient, AllergyIntolerance, CarePlan, CareTeam, Condition, Device, DiagnosticReport, DocumentReference, Goal, Immunization, MedicationRequest, Observation, Procedure, Encounter, Provenance. API base at api.qrshs.com/fhir, read-only access\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.qrshs.info/rwtp/RWT%20Results_25.pdf\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-documentation\",\n      \"note\": \"2025 Real World Testing Results — tested g(7), g(9), g(10) only per ONC enforcement discretion. Testing in sandbox/virtualized environment with 10 requests each, 100% success. Notes many clients don't regularly use Direct Messaging. Minimum 3 client practices tested\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://portal.qrshs.com/login\",\n      \"type\": \"vendor-website\",\n      \"note\": \"Patient portal login page — confirms portal exists, titled 'Portal - Login' with 'User Access' heading\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.bbb.org/search?find_text=QRS+Inc+Knoxville+TN\",\n      \"type\": \"third-party-review\",\n      \"note\": \"BBB search — no results found for QRS Inc in Knoxville TN\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.g2.com/search?query=PARADIGM+EHR+QRS\",\n      \"type\": \"third-party-review\",\n      \"note\": \"G2 — no results found for QRS or PARADIGM EHR\"\n    },\n    {\n      \"url\": \"https://www.capterra.com/p/search/?q=QRS+PARADIGM+EHR\",\n      \"type\": \"third-party-review\",\n      \"note\": \"Capterra — no results found for QRS PARADIGM\"\n    }\n  ]\n}\n"

  "command": "cd /home/exedev/ehi-export-analysis && git add results/qrs-inc/product-research.md results/qrs-inc/sources.json && git commit -m \"QRS, Inc. PARADIGM product research: small ambulatory EHR+PM vendor\n\n- Founded 1983 in Knoxville, TN; very small vendor, privately held\n- PARADIGM is unified EHR+PM with single shared database\n- Comprehensive ONC certification (39 criteria) for ambulatory use\n- Features: clinical charting, prescriptions, scheduling, billing, claims\n  (including UB04), clearinghouse, eligibility verification, patient portal\n- Operates own clearinghouse (2M+ claims/year)\n- Specialty modules: radiology, allergy, anesthesia, chiropractic, DME\n- EHI export via FHIR Data Portability module (C-CDA + JSON + files)\n- No third-party reviews found (G2, Capterra, BBB - no presence)\""

[RESULT: [main 79e438b1] QRS, Inc. PARADIGM product research: small ambulatory EHR+PM vendor
 Committer: exe.dev user <exedev@ehi-research.exe.xyz>
Your name and email address were configured automatically based
on your username and hostname. Please check that they are accurate.
You can suppress this message by setting them explicitly:

    git config --global user.name "Your Name"
    git config --global user.email you@example.com

After doing this, you may fix the identity used for this commit with:

    git commit --amend --reset-author

 2 files changed, 235 insertions(+)
 create mode 100644 results/qrs-inc/product-research.md
 create mode 100644 results/qrs-inc/sources.json
]
Done. Here's a summary of what I found:

## QRS, Inc. — PARADIGM® Research Summary

**What it is:** A very small, privately held vendor (founded 1983, Knoxville, TN) making PARADIGM®, an integrated ambulatory EHR + Practice Management system with a **single shared database** between clinical and billing.

**Key findings:**
- **Unified architecture** — EHR and PM share one database, meaning clinical data (chart notes, prescriptions, allergies, vitals, labs) and billing data (claims, payments, insurance, scheduling) are all in one system
- **Comprehensive certification** — 39 ONC criteria covering clinical, care coordination, patient portal, CQMs, public health, and FHIR APIs
- **Own clearinghouse** — QRS operates a clearinghouse processing 2M+ claims/year
- **Specialty support** — Radiology, allergy, anesthesia billing, chiropractic, DME
- **Vertically integrated** — software, hardware, networking, clearinghouse, payment processing, statement services, disaster recovery — all from one vendor
- **EHI export** — ZIP containing C-CDA XML + JSON (includes "invoice history") + imported files (PDF/PNG/etc.)
- **Very small vendor** — no presence on G2, Capterra, or BBB; RWT testing with 3 client practices in sandbox environments; expired SSL certificate on main website

**Key concern for later EHI assessment:** Since PARADIGM uses a single database for EHR+PM, the export should cover both clinical and billing/financial data. The EHI documentation mentions "invoice history" as a JSON export item, which is encouraging, but the full scope of billing data inclusion will need scrutiny in Phase 2.
